result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrin J Havanec was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Go Armed with Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $1100.00 including all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges from bail on deposit and balance to be paid forthwith or serve 20 consecutive days in the HOC.

charges.descr: Go Armed with Firearm While Intoxicated

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrin J Havanec

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received call from Def/Pet stating he wanted to cancel court date due to Oak Creek PD returning his property.
Return of property hearing at 11-20-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Darrin J Havanec in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.


Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve ONE in the House of Correction,with credit for ONE day time served. Court ordered a fine  of $1100.00 including all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges from bail on deposit and balance to be paid FORTHWITH   or serve 20 consecutive   days in the House of Correction.
  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. lr

15RM028522  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-11-2015
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 07-14-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Darrin J Havanec in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ON court's own motion , Bail set in the amount of $100.00 cash which can be posted out of custody at the clerk of courts office.

Defendant Darrin J Havanec in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri on behalf of attorney Mark Pecora.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Status Conference. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-19-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Darrin J Havanec
Current: 1700 Newberry Lane, Racine, WI 53402   (Effective: 05-14-2015)
Prior: 1700 Newberry Lane, Racine, WI 53402
Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).

Defendant Darrin J Havanec in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.vb
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5-14-2015 at 1:30pm
